summary:
Here is my Skyrim SweetFX config.
I added - SMAA,TVLEVELS,LUMASHARPEN,GAUSSIAN (Bloom),FILMGRAIN,
LIFTGAMMAGAIN,TONEMAP,VIBRANCE,CURVES and DITHER.
I even made a Border version for a more cinematic look.

SweetFX doesn\'t need a High End PC.
Depending on your hardware, it will only cost you about 4-8fps in performance.
descriptionHtml:
[center][B]Here is my Skyrim SweetFX config.
I added - [I][COLOR=\"Gray\"]SMAA,TVLEVELS,LUMASHARPEN,GAUSSIAN (Bloom),FILMGRAIN (You can turn it off if you want to.),
LIFTGAMMAGAIN,TONEMAP,VIBRANCE,CURVES[/I] and [I]DITHER[/I].[/COLOR]

Your feedback is welcome.

[img]http://abload.de/img/tesv.exe_dx9_20130804r5rlv.jpg[/img]

[COLOR=\"Silver\"]SweetFX doesn\'t need a High End PC.
Depending on your hardware, it will only cost you about 4-8fps in performance.[/COLOR]

I added a Border Version of my Skyrim preset.
If you like a cinematic look, try it out :)
Thanks CeeJay.dk for updating your Border-shader!
[img]http://abload.de/img/dx9iv.exe_dx9_2013073rpljg.jpg[/img]

To install it just copy all files from the .rar file into your Skyrim install folder.
-> [COLOR=\"Gray\"][I]SteamApps\\common\\Skyrim[/I][/COLOR]
After that, just start the game and enable/disable the shader with the \"Insert\" Key above the arrowkeys.
If you want to take some Screenshots with those shaders use the \"End->\" key above the arrowkeys.

You only need the 64bit version if you patched your Skyrim executable to 64bit.
Use the normal config first if you\'re not sure which version you have.
[/B][/center]


[B]•Update 1.7[/B]
[I]Small update to Tonemap,Liftgammagain,Curves.
Filmgrain shouldn\'t be that prominent anymore (Smaller grain).
Bloom isn\'t that wide anymore.[/I]

[B]•Update 1.6 [/B]
[I]Small update to Liftgammagain and Tonemap. 
Added more contrast.[/I]

Added an optional border version.[/I]

[B]•Update 1.5 (29.6.2013)[/B]
[I]So much for final version :D
Preset doesn\'t use DPX anymore. The same can be achieved with Liftgammagain.
Uses SMAA again. Looks like it is better than FXAA. Atleast with Downsampling.
More Filmgrain.
Darker areas are better visible now.[/I]

[B]•Update 1.4 (29.6.2013)[/B]
[I]Final version of my Skyrim preset.
I\'m not sure anymore what changed but it wasn\'t much.
I added some contrast and some kind of filmic effect to dark areas though.[/I]

[B]•Update 1.3[/B]
[I]Small update to DPX ( A bit less color ) and the Bloom. 
Now uses FXAA. Works better than SMAA in this game.[/I]

[B]•Update 1.2[/B]
[I]Made it a bit Sharper.[/I]

[B]•Update 1.1[/B]
[I]A more cinematic look. More Red, wider bloom and a bit more color as well.[/I]
author: K-putt

files.name: K-putte SweetFX Config - 64bit
files.changelogHtml:
•Update 1.5
Preset doesn't use DPX anymore. The same can be achieved with Liftgammagain.
Uses SMAA again. Looks like it is better than FXAA. Atleast with Downsampling.
More Filmgrain.
Darker areas are better visible now.
